title: Standardized Test Data Schema
description: Consistent format for all Islamic prayer time test data

metadata.authority: string - Official Islamic authority or organization name
metadata.fetched_date: string - Date when data was obtained (YYYY-MM-DD)
metadata.tier: number - 1 for official authority, 2 for reference implementation
metadata.data_year: string - Year of the prayer time data

coordinates.latitude: number - Geographic latitude in decimal degrees
coordinates.longitude: number - Geographic longitude in decimal degrees

metadata.location: string - City, Country or descriptive location
metadata.asr_school: string - Standard | Hanafi (optional, defaults to Standard)
metadata.data_count: number - Total number of test cases
metadata.reference_coordinates: string - Original coordinate format from source (optional)
metadata.notes: string - Additional notes about the data source (optional)

testCases.hijri_date: string - Hijri date in original format (optional)

quality_types.official_current: Current year data from official authority
quality_types.reference_validation: Generated for validation against reference implementation

coordinate_formats.note: Metadata uses object format, input uses array format for consistency with library API

timezone_requirements.prayer_times: All prayer times must include timezone offset in ISO format

validation_rules: All prayer times must be valid ISO datetime strings with timezone
Coordinates must be valid latitude (-90 to 90) and longitude (-180 to 180)
Method names must match the method_mappings PascalCase format
Timezone must be valid IANA timezone identifier
Date format must be YYYY-MM-DD in both date field and input.date
Optional fields can be omitted but must follow specified format when present
notes: Prayer time property 'syuruk' is used consistently (not 'sunrise')
Metadata coordinates use object format {latitude, longitude}
Input coordinates use array format [latitude, longitude]
All timestamps use ISO format with timezone information
Method names are standardized to PascalCase
Tier 1 = Official authority data, Tier 2 = Reference implementation
Optional fields include: hijri_date, day_name, reference_coordinates, api_method, notes
